melsucceeds

It's a shame how the Catholic church is trying to scapegoat gays by denying them an opportunity to become priests. They seem to forget about the heterosexual clergy who molested young girls. We need to say "enough is enough" and seek more media attention. I suggest we have a march or public platform in Washington, D.C. to address our issues. Gay marriage and homosexuals becoming priests are just sub topics within a larger topic. I get the sense that they want to deny gay people rights in every sector, period.

post_info.post_title: The Vatican Ban Homosexuals From Priesthood

Jaxian

When it comes to marriage equality, we speak of a law which treats gay people unfairly, and it is appropriate to make demonstrations to the government in hopes that they will change that law.
 
 But I consider it an infringment on religious freedom to pass a law preventing Catholics from allowing homosexuals to serve as priests. I would not mind holding a demonstration toward Catholic leaders in hopes that they decide their religious teachings are incorrect, but I would not agree with attempting to pass a law that forces Catholics to accept gay priests.

There is no room for the Pride movement in the priesthood, and rightly so. That's not what they're about.

 
 I suppose one could try to hide their homosexuality, in a very deep closet. Keep it to their most private conversations with God, when no one else is in the room to hear them. However, would it be wrong to express it in that way as well? Even if you hide it, you are still gay, and being deceitful to whomever will ask. They are saying there is no place for gay people in the priesthood.
Steeeeve

EZ made a great point on this. If a homosexual priest remains celibate to focus on the cause of Christ and does not push a homosexual agenda, then that's alright.

 not really in Gods view....remember the intentions and wants of a mans heart is known by God (in the Christian view) so it would putting a man in a position who doesn't renounce his sin to God.
jyoshu

That's what they are saying will happen. It's simply because they are gay, not based on whether or not they express their gay sexuality.

 
 Where have they said this? I'm sure you can provide the evidence that they would fire a priest simply if they say they are gay even trying to repent. 
 
 
I suppose one could try to hide their homosexuality, in a very deep closet. Keep it to their most private conversations with God, when no one else is in the room to hear them.

 
 Believe it or not, that's what most Christians do with many of the things that we have desires to do but know that it's not right for us to do. It's called temptation. And yes, we talk to God about it privately quite often, and keep it in a very deep closet.
 
 
However, would it be wrong to express it in that way as well? Even if you hide it, you are still gay, and being deceitful to whomever will ask.

 
 Well, they could also call themselves a thief if they have a propensity to steal things. Or a gossiper if they like to say bad things about people. Why would it be dishonest to know one has a propensity to steal but not tell anyone, as long as he is trying to repent and not steal?
wsm2506

and keep it in a very deep closet.
 Many of us have known that about you for a long time. Good to see you finally admit it.
Bassman

not really in Gods view....remember the intentions and wants of a mans heart is known by God (in the Christian view) so it would putting a man in a position who doesn't renounce his sin to God.

 Good point. My brother also alluded to that.
jyoshu

Many of us have known that about you for a long time. Good to see you finally admit it.

 
 Is this your idea of a joke? If so, it's pretty pathetic one. I was talking about the way all Christians deal with temptations of every kind.
JakeCJB
This is unnecessary. Gay and straight already must be celibate. This statement is for the purose of trying to teach gay people more shame for their sexuality.
